Issues.Title: Please fix your filesystem permissions, or try setting the 'MICROSOFTML_RESOURCE_PATH' environment variable
Issues.Body:
**System Information (please complete the following information):**
 - OS & Version: Linux
 - ML.NET Version: Microsoft.ML 2.0.0-preview.22313.1
 - .NET Version: .NET 6.0

**Describe the bug**

I deployed the following predictor:

```cs
            var mlContext = new MLContext();
            var emptySamples = new List<TextData>();
            var emptyDataView = mlContext.Data.LoadFromEnumerable(emptySamples);
            var gloVe300DPipeline = mlContext.Transforms.Text.NormalizeText("Text")
                .Append(mlContext.Transforms.Text.TokenizeIntoWords("Tokens", "Text"))
                .Append(mlContext.Transforms.Text.ApplyWordEmbedding(
                    "Features",
                    "Tokens",
                    WordEmbeddingEstimator.PretrainedModelKind.GloVe300D
                ));
            var gloVe300DTextTransformer = gloVe300DPipeline.Fit(emptyDataView);
            gloVe300DPredictor = mlContext.Model.CreatePredictionEngine<TextData,
                TransformedTextData>(gloVe300DTextTransformer);
```

Locally, when testing the function, I can generate the embedding without an issue.

Then, I deployed this code in a serverless lambda function and is getting the following error.

```json
{
    "ClassName": "System.InvalidOperationException",
    "Message": "Error downloading resource: Error trying to create directory : Path cannot be the empty string or all whitespace. (Parameter 'path').\nPlease fix your filesystem permissions, or try setting the 'MICROSOFTML_RESOURCE_PATH' environment variable to a writable folder\nModel file for Word Embedding transform could not be found! Please copy the model file 'glove.6B.300d.txt' from 'WordVectors/glove.6B.300d.txt' to 'mlnet-resources/WordVectors'.",
    "Data": {
        "Throwing component": "WordEmbeddings",
        "Parent component": null,
        "Phase": "Ensuring resources",
        "ML_IsMarked": 1
    },
    "InnerException": null,
    "HelpURL": null,
    "StackTraceString": "   at Microsoft.ML.Transforms.Text.WordEmbeddingTransformer.EnsureModelFile(IHostEnvironment env, Int32& linesToSkip, PretrainedModelKind kind)\n   at Microsoft.ML.Transforms.Text.WordEmbeddingTransformer..ctor(IHostEnvironment env, PretrainedModelKind modelKind, ColumnOptions[] columns)\n   at Microsoft.ML.Transforms.Text.WordEmbeddingEstimator.Fit(IDataView input)\n   at Microsoft.ML.Data.EstimatorChain`1.Fit(IDataView input)\n   at lambdaHandler.Parser..ctor() in /local/src/Handler/Parser.cs:line 133\n   at lambdaHandler.Function.ProcessInputFile(JobRequest jobReq, String localFilePath) in /local/src/Handler/Function.cs:line 153\n   at lambdaHandler.Function.FunctionHandler(SQSEvent invocationEvent, ILambdaContext context) in /local/src/Handler/Function.cs:line 139",
    "RemoteStackTraceString": null,
    "RemoteStackIndex": 0,
    "ExceptionMethod": null,
    "HResult": -2146233079,
    "Source": "Microsoft.ML.Transforms",
    "WatsonBuckets": null
}
```

**Expected behavior**

It is unclear what to set and where the files should be.

As part of my research, I downloaded the following files:

```
cd ml/models/wordvectors
wget https://mlpublicassets.blob.core.windows.net/assets/wordvectors/glove.6B.200d.txt
wget https://mlpublicassets.blob.core.windows.net/assets/wordvectors/glove.6B.300d.txt
```

Currently, I think the error comes from here

https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/e15ff5f984f2e4fa505fd92b7541ca9ae9db46fb/src/Microsoft.ML.Transforms/Text/WordEmbeddingsExtractor.cs#L637-L643

More specifically, 

https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/e15ff5f984f2e4fa505fd92b7541ca9ae9db46fb/src/Microsoft.ML.Transforms/Text/WordEmbeddingsExtractor.cs#L605-L648

> Per `Error trying to create directory`.

Where does it try creating the directory? How do I make it creating the directory inside `/tmp`?

Do I have to put the files, specifically `glove.6B.300d.txt` in some special directory? Add an environment variable? What should be the directory and file structure?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Please fix your filesystem permissions, or try setting the 'MICROSOFTML_RESOURCE_PATH' environment variable" (#6410)

Issues.Title: Add VBufferDataFrameCoumn to DataFrame
Issues.Body:
Adding VBuffer type to the DataFrame. I modeled this off the of StringDataFrameColumn. I am not sure if a more complex approach is needed for the VBuffer type. An IDataView containing VBuffer type will convert to a DataFrame correctly. 

Relevant issue: https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/issues/5872
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add VBufferDataFrameCoumn to DataFrame" (#6409)

Issues.Title: Add MaxModelToExplore exit strategy to AutoMLExperiment.
Issues.Body:
We are excited to review your PR.

So we can do the best job, please check:

- [x] There's a descriptive title that will make sense to other developers some time from now. 
- [ ] There's associated issues. All PR's should have issue(s) associated - unless a trivial self-evident change such as fixing a typo. You can use the format `Fixes #nnnn` in your description to cause GitHub to automatically close the issue(s) when your PR is merged.
- [x] Your change description explains what the change does, why you chose your approach, and anything else that reviewers should know.
- [x] You have included any necessary tests in the same PR.

This PR adds the following API
```
AutoMLExperiment.SetMaxModelToExplore(int maxModel);
```

To AutoMLExperiment, which cancels AutoML training once after `maxModel` has reached.

This is useful for image classification and text classification in model builder, where no sweeping search space is expected.

This api can also combined with `expeirment.SetTrainingTimeInSecond` to form up a customized exit strategy. 

@luisquintanilla for notification
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add MaxModelToExplore exit strategy to AutoMLExperiment." (#6402)

Issues.Title: AutoML Lexico Objectives
Issues.Body:
FLAML provides the option to define [lexico objectives](https://microsoft.github.io/FLAML/docs/Use-Cases/Tune-User-Defined-Function#lexicographic-objectives). 

By enabling this in ML.NET AutoML, you can define and prioritize which metrics to optimize for. 

## Dependencies

Tuner API
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "AutoML Lexico Objectives" (#6405)

Issues.Title: Unable to find an entry point named TF_StringEncodedSize in DLL tensorflow
Issues.Body:
**System Information:**
 - OS & Version:  Windows 11
 - ML.NET Version: ML.NET v1.7.1
 - .NET Version: .NET 6.0
 - SciSharp.TensorFlow.Redist Version: v2.7.0

**Describe the bug**
When I try to learn `MobilenetV2` using the `mlContext.MulticlassClassification.Trainers
.ImageClassification` API on ML.NET version 1.7.1 and Redist version 2.7.0 I get the following error: `System.EntryPointNotFoundException: 'Unable to find an entry point named 'TF_StringEncodedSize' in DLL 'tensorflow'.'`

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Try to learn  `MobilenetV2` using the `SciSharp.TensorFlow.Redist  v2.7.0` or run the code on my [GIT](https://github.com/horczech/MLDotNetBug)

**Expected behavior**
The model will get successfully trained.


**Screenshot**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5252663/197462660-6814344a-7901-496d-9a35-0158be6dacd4.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to find an entry point named TF_StringEncodedSize in DLL tensorflow" (#6404)

Issues.Title: Microsoft.ML package contains an empty Microsoft.ML dll
Issues.Body:
**Describe the bug**
Microsoft.ML.dll is shipped but contains no types.

When fixing https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/pull/6399 I noticed that we ship another package with an empty dll.

I tried to remove the dll from that package, but in doing so it would remove all the symbols.
https://github.com/ericstj/machinelearning/commit/d9eaee5c5f19e163bb0f6a972caac40a47833c80

This is due to the problem described in https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10860#issuecomment-1287494174.

We can pursue a fix in NuGet then once we have it remove this useless assembly from the package.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Microsoft.ML package contains an empty Microsoft.ML dll" (#6401)

Issues.Title: Sentence Similarity
Issues.Body:
@luisquintanilla
Refactor of the TextClassificationTransformer to enable easier code reuse for other NAS-BERT scenarios by moving common code to a base class.

Adding in SentenceSimilarity with associated API. Currently getting about .5 for the Spearmen correlation value but it should 
 be closer to .7 so I am investigation this to see which config setting I have different.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Sentence Similarity" (#6390)

Issues.Title: AutoML Featurizer handling of label column
Issues.Body:
## Problem

Currently when using the `Featurizer` with `ColumnInformation` from `ColumnInferenceResults` there is no easy way to exclude the label column from featurization or automatically featurize it as well. Therefore you either need to pass in an IDataView with the dropped columns or you need to individually provide the column type parameters (i.e. `numericColumns`). 

```csharp
var pipeline =
    ctx.Auto().Featurizer(
        data: dataView,
        numericColumns: columnInferenceResults.ColumnInformation.NumericColumnNames.ToArray(),
        outputColumnName: "Features",
        excludeColumns: new[] { "Label" })
        .Append(ctx.Auto().MultiClassification());

```
 
## Proposal

1. Automatically featurize label column (this is often the case for classification scenarios where values need to be converted to `KeyType`).

2. Create an overload of `Featurizer` with the following signature:

```csharp
Featurizer(IDataView data, ColumnInformation columnInformation, string[] excludeColumns, string outputColumnName)
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "AutoML Featurizer handling of label column" (#6400)

Issues.Title: use IMLContextManager to create child mlcontext from main context in AutoMLExperiment
Issues.Body:
We are excited to review your PR.

So we can do the best job, please check:

- [x] There's a descriptive title that will make sense to other developers some time from now. 
- [ ] There's associated issues. All PR's should have issue(s) associated - unless a trivial self-evident change such as fixing a typo. You can use the format `Fixes #nnnn` in your description to cause GitHub to automatically close the issue(s) when your PR is merged.
- [x] Your change description explains what the change does, why you chose your approach, and anything else that reviewers should know.
- [x] You have included any necessary tests in the same PR.

This PR moves the logic of creating child context from main context into `IMLContextManager` and add tests for that code.

The reason why we don't directly train on main context is because `AutoMLExperiment` will cancel the context if time is out and we want to prevent from cancelling on main context so it doesn't affect on further training.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "use IMLContextManager to create child mlcontext from main context in AutoMLExperiment" (#6395)

Issues.Title: update torchsharp to 0.98.1
Issues.Body:

Fixes #6392

Issues.Title: Fix CMake warning on Linux
Issues.Body:
Cmake emits a warning because MKL_LIB_RPATH is specified but not used.

Fix this by consuming the property in the project that makes the decision to use it or not.

I chose to suppress the warning this way rather than duplicate the condition in more places.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix CMake warning on Linux" (#6391)

Issues.Title: Outdated version of .NET Interactive breaks interactive extensions in notebooks
Issues.Body:
Installing components with interactive extensions `Microsoft.Data.Analysis` and `Microsoft.ML.AutoML` breaks in notebooks.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46974588/195719486-506e99c8-0f84-4aa2-aef7-c9d929df793e.png)

Update version to latest: 1.0.0-beta.22504.6

https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/c5f03e2c42940b23ea3f9eed88f23807d9f26453/eng/Versions.props#L38

https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/c5f03e2c42940b23ea3f9eed88f23807d9f26453/eng/Versions.props#L39

The version for formatting and interactive is always in sync, so it's recommended to use just one variable.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Outdated version of .NET Interactive breaks interactive extensions in notebooks" (#6381)

Issues.Title: XGBoost Trainer interface (WIP)
Issues.Body:
We are excited to review your PR.

So we can do the best job, please check:

- [x] There's a descriptive title that will make sense to other developers some time from now. 
- [ ] There's associated issues. All PR's should have issue(s) associated - unless a trivial self-evident change such as fixing a typo. You can use the format `Fixes #nnnn` in your description to cause GitHub to automatically close the issue(s) when your PR is merged.
- [x] Your change description explains what the change does, why you chose your approach, and anything else that reviewers should know. (see below)
- [ ] You have included any necessary tests in the same PR. (forthcoming)

Replaces PR #6345 in using a `Trainer` rather than a `Transformer` interface for the XGBoost integration.   Currently, only a regression trainer is enabled, but a binary classifier is in progress.   To run, the user is expected to have a copy of the xgboost library appropriate to their system and available (maybe through a mechanism like updates to their `PATH` or `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` environment variables).  We are working in ways to reduce the burden of this requirement.

Please expect some edits to this PR, including the addition of unit tests.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "XGBoost Trainer interface (WIP)" (#6383)
